articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's armed forces have made gains in different parts of eastern Donetsk region, the focal point of Russia's 18-month-old invasion of the country, and in the south, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukrainian military advances in Donetsk region and south, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rescuers raced on Sunday to rescue an American caver who had become trapped more than 1,000 metres (3,300 ft) underground in southern Turkey, moving him halfway to the surface.
articles.title: US caver who became trapped 1,000 metres deep in Turkey is moved halfway to surface

articles.author: Felix Light, Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Hikmet Hajiev, a foreign policy advisor to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, on Saturday denied that Baku had reached a deal with the breakaway province of Nagorno-Karabakh to simultaneously reopen roads to Azerbaijan and Armenia.
articles.title: Azerbaijan denies deal reached to reopen Karabakh-Armenia road

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 26 people died and several others were missing after a ferry capsized on a reservoir in north central Nigeria on Sunday, local officials said, the second such major accident to hit the region in three months.
articles.title: At least 26 killed in Nigeria ferry accident

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greek rescue teams recovered the bodies of three more people in central Greece on Sunday, raising the death toll to 14 from the country's most intense rain storm since records began in 1930.
articles.title: Three more bodies found after Greece storm, raising toll to 14

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Niger's junta on Sunday accused France of deploying troops in several West African countries as part of preparations for a possible military intervention together with the regional bloc ECOWAS in Niger.
articles.title: Niger junta accuses France of deploying troops for possible intervention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dutch police on Sunday said more than 500 climate activists had been detained on a second consecutive day of protests against government subsidies for the fossil fuel industry.
articles.title: Dutch police detain 500 activists on second day of climate protests

articles.author: Jihed Abidellaoui, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Rescuers searched on Sunday for survivors of Morocco's deadliest earthquake in more than six decades, with more than 2,000 people killed by the disaster that has laid waste to villages in the mountains outside Marrakech.
articles.title: Rescuers hunt for survivors of Morocco quake with over 2,000 dead

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Sunday he held his highest-level talks with Chinese leadership in months, adding that Beijing's economic wobbles would not lead it to invade Taiwan.
articles.title: Biden meets China leader Li, says economic woes make Taiwan invasion less likely

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Lee was churning west-northwest in the tropical Atlantic Ocean and was expected to bring dangerous surf and rip currents to the U.S. East Coast from Sunday night into next week, the U.S. National Hurricane Center said.
articles.title: Hurricane Lee to bring dangerous surf conditions to U.S. East Coast
